refnamediv.refpurpose: Get the decimal digit value of a code point for a given radix

Returns the decimal digit value of the code point in the specified radix.
If the radix is not in the range 2<=radix<=36 or if the value of codepoint is not a valid digit in the specified radix, &false; is returned. A character is a valid digit if at least one of the following is true:
The character has a decimal digit value. Such characters have the general category "Nd" (decimal digit numbers) and a Numeric_Type of Decimal. In this case the value is the character's decimal digit value. The character is one of the uppercase Latin letters 'A' through 'Z'. In this case the value is c-'A'+10. The character is one of the lowercase Latin letters 'a' through 'z'. In this case the value is ch-'a'+10. Latin letters from both the ASCII range (0061..007A, 0041..005A) as well as from the Fullwidth ASCII range (FF41..FF5A, FF21..FF3A) are recognized.
